None of the unlocking tricks nor keyboard lockouts would work; it was unfortunately just dead.  Am returning it for refund, so cannot rate it if it doesn't work.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 25, 2020
CommentsContent: disappointed! Incorrect description. Monitor is 60HZ NOT 75HZ.

CommentsTitle: quality product, excellent versatile stand, no power brick
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2021
CommentsContent: I'm probably approaching the purchase of a monitor from a different perspective from many. I wanted a reasonably large monitor but not so large that I couldn't remove it from the table for weekends. Nevertheless, i wanted the ability to rotate the screen to fit a letter on it comfortably. i had also wanted lightweight.The HP  has a brilliant stand, & is v sturdy.  it allows sliding the monitor up & down, at an angle, & yes it does allow full rotation. I read in questions varying answers. The trick to rotation is that one has to slide the monitor as far up from the base as possible, then angle it upwards, at which point it will then  will clear the bottom to allow rotation; otherwise it will not.i wanted a screen that prevents eye fatigue. ASUS advertises this in its headline description. HP has the ability  in its menu to select low blue light, which is the main way to reduce eye fatigue.  The menu system is v easy to use & access.  It also has HP enhance + which I highly recommend in other situations.  The versatility of positioning of the monitor makes for much less stress on eyes too.The screen with stand is not the  lightest at 10 pounds for a 24 inch but  not terrible.  This includes the  magnificent stand which  is v easy to detach unlike many others. Its a simple push to disengage, & pull at the back. This allows for easy storage, in my case over weekends. Keep the packing material to protect the screen. Id say that added at least a few pounds, & was completely worth it.  The monitor also  incorporates the brick many monitors leave with the cable. I don't like all those power cables with bricks, so i welcome the choice. again this adds a pound but avoids clumsiness and unsightly wiring.resolution is reasonable on par with most other basic monitors. the refresh rate apparently can run up to 75hz but i haven't tested this with my Chromebook. the usb-c displayport works perfectly .For the price this is excellent value. a premium build monitor for a basic price.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 15, 2020
CommentsContent: I was about to buy vh240a and then Amazon recommended this newer model 24mh. I already have two vh240a, so I know how good it has been. But, this is even better.1. Better speaker quality than vh240a. I felt that this speaker is in an acceptable level now. vh240a speaker was the last option I would pick to hear something out of my PC.2. Extra port - Display port. A good reason I chose this model as my PC ran out of hdmi3. No adapter brick, just the power cable directly to the display. It's 2020 and I believe we don't need to compromise. Check!4. Picture quality - No complaints there. Just as good or slightly better than vh240a5. Not really sure, but this felt pretty light if you exclude the stand. So, looks like it will do well with different stands and mountsGo for it! You will not be disappointed.

CommentsTitle: BEWARE! There's a reason this monitor is CHEAP!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 3, 2020
CommentsContent: I was on the fence about buying this monitor but ended up doing so because of the hp brand name. Within two hours of use the screen has LED-backlighting burned into it. This is where the edges of the screen become burnt and discolored from poorly manufactured led lighting. Also, the picture is absurdly dark. I also suspect this to be the faulty LEDs. I went in to check the brightness and contrast setting only to find that both settings were already set near the max by factory default!  It's such a shame that amazon suggested this to me and that hp would put their name on something that's clearly defective. Don't be fooled by the nice trailers and good reviews like I was, just pay the extra $50 and get the monitor you actually want. It really is sad how far the quality standard has fallen. Well, I hope this helps others avoid this monitor like the plague.

CommentsTitle: Great monitor for the price but I needed rich 4k resolution.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 1, 2020
CommentsContent: I kinda feel bad for rating this 4 stars but I have to. This is a great product for the price. My only problem is it was not what I needed. I have a 4k Dell XPS laptop and the color on my laptop is phenomenal. This monitor (I bought 2) is only FHD up to 1920 x 1080 resolution. It does not look that good next to UHD 3840 x 2160. Sooo, it depends on what you need and what you are looking for. For the price, it is unbeatable. I'm a developer and designer and I need rich color. If used on a different laptop with a lower video card, I would probably have kept these. Yes, I returned them. Thanks to Amazon for a no hassle return. I ended up buying 2 4k UHD monitors that have yet to arrive. I should see a significant difference.

CommentsTitle: Macbook users - you have nothing to worry about!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2021
CommentsContent: Bought this to use as a monitor for my 2017 MacBook Air as the 13" screen was starting to strain my eyes. For some context, I'm a student and my primary use for the screen is to read read read and take lots of notes. I've read a few reviews about issues with the resolution from a mac to this screen, and the surefire way to make sure none of those issues happen is to buy a thunderbolt to hdmi cable - I bought one from amazon basics a couple years ago and it works seamlessly - edge to edge display and full resolution. It's not a 4k monitor or anything but with how big it is and how far back you sit, it's all the same in terms of crisp, clear picture. I don't use my computer for gaming really so I cannot comment on the graphics/resolution for that purpose - but for your basic office or school work - it's perfect.Not sure what a solution would be for newer mac models that have only the usb-c output. Also, this was bought in Feb 2021 and it seems like the latest model comes with built in speakers, has a tilt feature, and vertical sliding to adjust the height. For this price, I think the value is unbeatable. The only downside is that there seems to be no external volume control, but I have my bluetooth headphones in most of the time anyway so it doesn't matter. It also comes with an aux cord to connect to external speakers, and a regular hdmi cable.If you're hesitating on this product, there's a reason it's the #1 seller on computer monitors on amazon!

CommentsTitle: Update- don’t spend any money on this
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 8, 2020
CommentsContent:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.










  
  
    
   Update: day 2 and the screen bleed is impossible photo included with a corner of a card so you can see it’s not the camera that’s blurry. I would revise to say even if tight on budget do not get this.Day 1 review:If you are tight on money this will meet basic needs. But if you spend long hours at a computer this monitor is very frustrating. All texts looks a bit blurry, and the unit i was sent has a constant strobing white line at top of the display. Only goes away when set to 800x600 display size which is basically like viewing your iPhone through a magnifying glass. Letters aren’t crisp. When rotated to verticals the display colors bleed so badly it’s laughable.

CommentsTitle: Great monitors but they display 2 different colors
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2021
CommentsContent: I got two of these for my home office and honestly the monitors are great, it was a little difficult to get the one assembled due to a jammed part but that was resolved after putting in a little bit of elbow grease. My main issue with the monitors is that when connected into the same extension cord from my macbook pro the screen resolution is totally different on each monitor even though they are set to the same thing. I'll attach photos in a bit but overall its worth it if you don't run into this issue.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 1, 2020
CommentsContent: Have to concur with other reviewers - this is a great 24" monitor at this price point. Assembly and height adjustment are smooth. Low blue light option is a plus for detail spreadsheet work etc.  I disagree with some reviewers as I think the included speakers are pretty decent - better for watching downloaded TV shows than my own laptop's Bang & Olufsen speakers.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 20, 2020
CommentsContent: I purchased this monitor to replace an Acer 24" 1080p monitor that had lasted me over 7 years. I liked it because of the thin bezel and the price was great. The first monitor I received had discolored pixels in various places (see image) that would move depending on what was displayed on the screen. I tried several cables and even another computer, but the dead pixel look never let up. I installed the drivers for the monitor and updated my graphics drivers as well, with no success.After this I got a replacement monitor. The replacement monitor was worse because it showed up in packaging that had clearly been put back together after having been opened and used, and the screen had fingerprints and smudges on it. The second monitor also had the same pixel issues, except that it was also having an issue where the screen turns black every 30 seconds or so. Definitely disappointed and getting a refund.

CommentsTitle: Bad set-up/menu software, mediocre picture quality...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 12, 2021
CommentsContent: But, it is cheap and not just in price.  Picture quality on the one we received is just OK if you can look past the light bleed around most of the edges and corners. I could probably live with that because of the price but there are other problems.  The setup/menu software for adjusting the monitor is sparse and some of the features keep changing on their own, for example, the sound setup/menu for the built-in speakers.  Because I am using an HDMI cable for the picture and a line-in cable from an external sound source for the sound the monitor wants to use the HDMI cable as a source for the sound to the speakers so it resets itself every time the computer is shutdown or rebooted.  If I don't go into the menu setup of the monitor each time the drivers are updated or the system is shutdown or rebooted we don't have any sound and we need to change the setup back to using the line-in cable as the source, then it works fine, until the next time (even the computer going into sleep mode causes this problem).Went to HP,s support site only to find one set of drivers and manuals designed to work over a wide array of their monitors and no firmware updates to fix this problem (or anything else for that matter) and they want to blame everything and everybody else as a source for the problem instead of the problematic software that they refuse to acknowledge is the problem.  I guess the old saying "you get what you pay for" is the lesson here.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 30, 2020
CommentsContent: Literally, it took me longer to open the box than it did to get this great monitor up and running!Picture Quality is great, internal Monitor Speakers sound great, but this computer utilizes a 3-Speaker Home Theatre quality external sound system, so the internal monitor speakers are not needed. This monitor is a very fast monitor and has limited to no ghosting, video's are sharp and clear, text is great and scalable.For $110, including shipping this is the buy of the year from HP. You will not go wrong with this monitor.Oh! The stand that comes with it is superb and allows you to rotate into "portrait" mode for document processing!I have been in computers for over 45 years and this is the best I have seen on low cost monitors!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 1, 2020
CommentsContent: Got this gem a week ago. Setup was easy. I'm using this one as a second monitor attached to my laptop so I can use 3d modeling software. This monitor also has speakers in the rear, an interesting add-on.Pros: high quality image, clear picture, brightness, and accessible menu controls; screen can be adjusted on tilt and vertical axis (raised/lowered to eye level); excellent cost-to-value product for casual users to do business, browsing, etc. Would function fine for games but doesn't have the high resolution for most recent games based on 4K specs.Cons: some light bleed (about 1.5" on the right bezel) but not enough to warrant a return; cable ports can be hard to access, especially VGA given the need to screw the port head in (although HDMI is a simple insertion). I get why ports are positioned this way but I would hope in today's modern era they'd make it easier to insert a cable. Some may not like the adjustable height mechanism to raise/lower the display. Display cannot be rotated horizontally. It is fixed straight ahead.Despite these minor complaints, I love this monitor. At at time when monitors are headed to 4K and 8K resolutions, costing hundreds of dollars, the HP 24mh delivers impressive quality at a nice price.

CommentsTitle: Moderate Picture Quality, Misleading Audio Options
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2021
CommentsContent: I'm not sure if I got a lemon, or if I'm just the victim of some poor or misleading advertising. The only way I can get audio to the speakers is via HDMI. Except there's no volume controls on the monitor, and most systems (including macs, gaming consoles, etc) don't allow you to adjust volume before outputting, so there's no way to adjust system volume using HDMI for audio.It came with a male-to-male 3.5mm audio cable, the type you'd expect to use to connect speakers to your computer. But in plugging the cable into the monitor and the computer, I don't get any sound. The only way I've found to get sound is to switch the audio output on my computer back from headphones to hdmi. So I don't know if the audio jack is a broken input, or if it's actually an output that allows your audio from the hdmi to go to external speakers. The fact that the audio port is completely unmarked doesn't help, either.As for the display itself, it's OK I guess. The quality isn't as good as the iMac that it replaced, despite the fact that my iMac was over 8 years old. The brightness and colors are passable, but it seems noticeably less sharp, even though this monitor and my old iMac both have a resolution of 1080p.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 3, 2020
CommentsContent: Man, this things is WOW. The first thing I noticed is the bright beautiful color. Second, it is very light (but not too light). It was literally a plug and play situation. I'm using the included HDMI cord and the speakers are great. I'm not a gamer, so this isn't that type of review. I am, however, someone who now works from home half the time and was desperately in need of a better monitor. This was a very affordable and effective solution. A++

CommentsTitle: To get a big picture you have to overscan
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2021
CommentsContent: When I hooked up this monitor the screen didn’t fill to the edges.  I played with the menu and found overscan enlarges the view past the edges of the screen.  In fact it enlarges it too much so I am using it with a 3/8” black margin all the way around.Yes it has speakers. Yes, I had to go in the menu and inform the monitor I wanted to use the green cable instead of the HDMI for the audio.  The only thing that bothers me is that the audio goes back to the HDMI default every time I power off the computer.I gave everything five stars because my beloved wife is planning to steal this monitor when I am not paying attention so I will probably buy another one.Update:  I was experiencing intermittent blinking of the monitor so I moved it to my wife’s computer and changed the monitor cable.  I now find the screen is filled completely and the blinking has stopped.  I am thinking that the video card in the computer contributes to this monitor’s performance.I remain happy with this purchase.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 3, 2020
CommentsContent: I purchased two of these monitors for my home office.  One worked perfectly and the other had apparently been dropped before I received it.  The first time I turned the monitor on there was a huge area in the upper corner where no image displayed and there are three large shatter marks that are only visible when the screen is turned on.  I have already ordered a replacement and the new monitor will arrive tomorrow.  Hopefully the replacement monitor will be fully functional.  **update** new monitor was received the next day and it works perfectly. Definitely would recommend purchasing.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 9, 2020
CommentsContent: No remote is a bummer. Screen brightness, contrast, sharpness all need to be at max settings to get a decent picture.The audio volume level and mute functions are not working over the HDMI cable .  Tried higher quality cable, no difference.  We have Frontier cable box and although I set the box to enable audio volume to be controlled over thevia the box, no audio notifications appear on the TV.  The volume can be controlled in the box settings and the setting saved but when I push the volumne up/down buttonson the box remote, nothing happens.  The volume can also be controlled bu going into the TV settings, but this requires many button pushes to get to that function.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 18, 2020
CommentsContent: Just received this HP 24mh FHD Monitor and set it up today. I saw some reviews that the refresh rate could not be set up to 75 hertz. I have a HDMI port on my Lenovo T480 laptop so I used a HDMI cable, connected it to this monitor, and the refresh rate showed up 75 hertz (see attached photo.)However, if I connect my HDMI cable to my USB C dongle (my dongle has a HDMI connection as well), the refresh rate can only be 60 hertz if connected to a dongle. I have a 2019 MacBook and it doesn't have HDMI connection so I use my USB C dongle to connect this HP monitor to my MacBook. The rate can be 60 hertz (see attached photo.)Therefore, my conclusion would be that you would need to have a direct HDMI connection directly connected your computer with the monitor. If you would use dongles, the refresh rate would be reduced.By the way, the shipping package is very well packed. A HDMI cable and a sound cable are included in the package, so it's very convenient. The Quick Setup Guide is very helpful, very easy to follow to set up the monitor.So far the monitor works great. It can be adjusted up and down and also tilt forward or backward just as it described on the product description on the Amazon website.Well, I just used it for a few hours. So far I’m very satisfied and I think this product is totally worth your money. It actually exceeds my expectation in many ways because the price is $109.

CommentsTitle: Trust your gut!!! This monitor is great and HAS SPEAKERS!!!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 31, 2020
CommentsContent: Ok so I ordered mine with my Amazon Christmas gift cards, along with a couple other things. I ordered it Christmas Day and got it when specified, when setting it up I had some trouble with the base but once everything lined up it all came together perfectly. It was easy set up I have it plugged into an older HP laptop, which has all the current windows 10 updates. The picture quality is amazing, and I’m still baffled how big the screen is for the price, it’s like the size of the small television my parents have in their room. I’m streaming Futurama on it through my provider on it as I’m writing this and even my dad dad walked by and even being as nit picky as he is he was impressed. I got it mainly for when school starts up again, and it added more space to my desk and something bigger where I’m not hunched over a laptop staring at a screen and sitting so close as I type (I got a wireless keyboard to go with it) it moves up and down very easily without worry.I gave it four stars for gaming because while I intend to use it for school I do have every intention of playing my PS4 on it, and watching a gamer video on it the quality seems very good. THIS HAS SPEAKERS!!!!!!!! Don’t let other reviews say it doesn’t, it has speakers. I didn’t even have to adjust them when I set it up they just worked immediately. All in all great product that does have speakers, I know some people are SO picky  (it’s understandable) but at $109 for this amount of quality I am definitely happy and won’t pick apart it’s flaws, which I have found none so far!!!

CommentsTitle: Great computer, and YES, it has 75Hz and Great Audio.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2021
CommentsContent: As someone who just started working from home, it was imperative that I get two good working monitors. I had never really bought myself a monitor before, and studied a lot about the different specs for a monitor, like refresh rate, resolution, panel type, etc. I also needed something affordable that would fit my budget.This was THE BEST find! I love it so much and it has exceeded my expectations, and I only bought them for $109.99 each! I never had an HP computer before, so I am definitely pleased. It was super easy to set up, the screen is like matte and not glossy. You can see everything clearly and it is super wide, just how I like it. You can also turn the monitor’s screen so it is vertical! So helpful when I am looking at excel sheets. You don’t even need to take the screen off of it’s base to rotate the screen vertically! They give you an HDMI cord and power cord for each monitor, so I was able to just follow the guide they provided and set it up in only 20-30 minutes.People have complained about the audio and the refresh rate not being 75 Hz...so I was hesitant to buy it. But I saw some other reviews and was able to toggle the menu and adjust the audio for both monitors, so I am able to get really good sound! Also, if you want to change the refresh rate, literally all you have to do is download Graphics Command Center on the Microsoft Store, go to Display settings and literally adjust the monitors refresh rate from there. BAM! 75 HzThe only reason why I am giving it four stars is because I wish there were more USB ports on the monitors. I realize now I may actually never use the VGA port...also, I am not certain the warranty on these devices, especially from Amazon, will totally help me if anything were to happen to these monitors.But so far, I AM VERY PLEASED WITH MY PURCHASE. :)

CommentsTitle: Great monitors! They DO have 75Hz support!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2021
CommentsContent: These monitors are great. I got 2 for a dual monitor setup and couldn't be happier. Very thin bezels, good colors, and easy VESA mounting process. In the box is the monitor, an HDMI cable, an audio AUX cord, and a power cord to plug the monitor in.For some reason, a lot of reviews for these monitors are negative because they "don't actually have 75hz refresh rate". They do. The default is 60hz, but there's an easy way to change that (on windows, at least).Right click on your desktop > Click "display settings" > Scroll down and look for "Advanced display settings". Click that. > Under "Refresh Rate", click the drop-down box, and select 74.973 Hz. > Done!Overall this is a great monitor for the cost. Would highly recommend for anyone looking for a solid monitor in this price range.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 7, 2020
CommentsContent: I did a ridiculous amount of comparison shopping to find an extra monitor for my older MacBook **. I am so glad I settled on this one!Among things that make me extremely happy:> It has a phenomenal picture quality.> It looks super sleek and classy as it has no border but for the bottom.> Base is solid with zero wobble (note that the base IS a little big which about the only negative thing I can say about this monitor).- Controls are on the bottom of the monitor, not the back or side - they are hidden but accessible and menus are intuitive.- Love the tilt and the up/down adjustability.- Speakers are actually way better than I expected. They are actually pretty good.- Whatever all the stats are that denote how smooth the action is and how little choppiness there is - this is wonderful. I do not experience any discernible lag with mouse movement or typing.- Comes with an HDMI cord!!** My MacBook has a Mini DisplayPort only, no HDMI, and I knew I would need an adapter. Thanks to a knowledgable reviewer I knew to buy an ACTIVE Mini DisplayPort to HDMI Adapter. Apparently this is an important distinction. The adapter was about twenty dollars, which I had no problem paying for a good piece of equipment. I must have made the right decision because the connection seems seamless.

CommentsTitle: Absolute value.  easy set up, good display options, audio is fine
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 6, 2021
CommentsContent: At just over $100, this is an excellent value.  Key reasons for the enthusiastic endorsement- easy set up- clean, crisp display and low bluelight option- slim profile, thin bezels provide a very sleek, modern look- included hdmi and audio cables (obviously the power supply)- the speakers work fine for its intended purpose for me (just streaming music while working);  confused about reviews that say it has no speakers.  I am able to change the audio setting from my default to "HP 24mh" and get the audio streamed to the monitor just with the hdmi cable.The only con is the packaging, I am sure HP can find a way to ship these without having to rely on thermocol.Overall, a fantastic value for a well known brand.  Longevity is of course always an issue of "time will tell"

CommentsTitle: No VESA as advertised so cannot mount a mini computer on back.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 14, 2020
CommentsContent: Fine monitor for all uses except I bought this as VESA is right there in the description yet nowhere are the 4 holes for a mini computer to be mounted in the back of the screen or on the stand. It would save so much hassle for an honest description is all.

CommentsTitle: Screen is bright and sharp - strongly recommended
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 24, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought this monitor to be the 2nd monitor of a dual monitor set.  It is do much brighter and clearer than the primary monitor that it only stayed 2nd monitor for about 2 minutes.  That's how long it took to swap the cables to make this one primary.I don't need the speakers but I did see them on the back of the monitor.  Writing this I think I may just connect them to see what they sound like.I highly recommend this monitor so far, it arrived today.  If anything contrary turns up I will revise this review.

CommentsTitle: Excellent FHD monitor with built in speakers and multiple connection ports
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 11, 2021
CommentsContent: I purchased this monitor to upgrade from a 19" Dell.  I have found it to be a very good viewing size. Speakers provide good sound, and it is one of a few with a DisplayPort connection.  This was very much needed as my docking station needs DisplayPorts for connectivity.  Buyer should be aware: A HDMI cable is provided. However, a DisplayPort, or VGA cable or audio connectors aren't. The base does not swivel.  It does have height and tilt adjustment, rotation from landscape to portrait view.  Speaker volume, display, brightness, and other options are done via the onscreen management settings.  I would recommend to download the display driver from HP for this unit, to ensure it is properly recognized on your laptop or PC. Overall, I found it to be a good price/performance value.

CommentsTitle: VESA mountable, but you'll need a bracket
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2021
CommentsContent: I bought two of these monitors to be mounted to a dual monitor arm setup. Three star review because the vendor should have been clearer about the fact that you will need to buy a VESA bracket separately. To attach the monitor to the dual monitor arm setup I bought, I had to purchase a "Vesa 200mm X 100mm Universal LCD LED Bracket". This is the one I bought:  https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00U3DQO6I/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o01_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1I also had to purchase additional screws because the ones included are too short. I bought M4-0.7 x 18mm screws from my local hardware store which fit my monitor. Good luck! The picture quality and brightness are good. I lowered my overall rating because I specifically bought these monitors because they were advertised as VESA compatible. It was very disappointing to get them home and discover I needed to purchase additional hardware.

CommentsTitle: Great monitor, but price has increased..
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 17, 2020
CommentsContent: Fantastic monitor. Needed to upgrade an old monitor at work to something with VESA compatibility. Admittedly I bought the cheapest monitor with VESA, and this just happened to be the one. WOW! I am thoroughly pleased with this monitor. Firstly, incredibly lightweight. Setup on the VESA mount took 5 minutes, because you can hold this thing with one hand no problem. Secondly, picture quality is great! I'm not gaming on this, just typing emails, web browsing, office-type work. The brightness is adequate and easily adjustable. Thirdly, what a deal. $109.99 is what I paid, though it seems to have gone up a lot. That was my only reason for buying this monitor originally, the price. Now that it's increased I would definitely consider exploring other options just to see if you can't get more bang for your buck. On that note, this monitor is fantastic and I would buy it again, but only at the original price point.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 13, 2020
CommentsContent: This was a fine monitor--for about 30 days.  Then one day I turned it on and there are lines all over it and a black spot in the shape of a leaf.  If zero was a rating option, that's what I would give it. I don't have the box anymore, so I can't return it to Amazon.  I have spent about 6 hours in chats and on the phone with HP trying to get the POS replaced, but to no avail.  They keep making promises, but not following through.  After 3 separate contacts, I was told to call back if I didn't get a confirmation that a new monitor was on the way.  Not worth my time to spend another hour fighting with them.  Not only will I say that this item was a piece of crap, but HP's service has convinced me that I will never spend another dime on any HP product ever again; they obviously don't stand behind their product so why would I?If you decide to go ahead and get this POS monitor, keep the box, at least for the duration of the Amazon return because no way HP is going to help you out if it stops working.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 24, 2020
CommentsContent: Purchased 2 of these to complete my home office...no regrets so far. Perfect size and clarity. Also love the thin bezels. Great bang for the buck!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2021
CommentsContent: I bought this for working from home so I could actually see things I was struggling with, on the tiny laptop screen. I didn’t want to deal with switching between the two laptops fighting over 1 monitor so I got this to be a dedicated 2nd screen for a 2nd laptop. This HP monitor was bigger than I realized but it’s such a relief to my eyes compared to the small laptop display. It has the capability to rises nice and tall, tilts and it was really easy to assemble in under 10 minutes right out of the box. It came with 1 hdmi cable and also has a port for the vga option if you need that like I did. I had a spare so just know you’ll need to get your own vga cable. It has a nice edge-free design (the only plastic border is at the bottom and it’s a silver color) which looks cool and gives you more screen area.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2021
CommentsContent: had them for a week, love the looks. It was very easy to connect. However, I had slight issue with one of the monitors. After 5 days, there was a vertical black line on the right side. I called Amazon and was told to gently press on the line and it disappeared. For the last 3 days, it has not come back. not sure of the reason why it appeared first. at night, it automatically changes the setting to nightlight for your eyes. Overall, it is very good quality.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2021
CommentsContent: Things I liked about it (based on the price vs value estimate) :1. Has height adjustments2. Good tilt adjustment3. Ability to rotate the screen horizontally or vertically4. VESA mount capable5. Has decent speakers6. Flicker free display with multiple modes like reading, low blue light and stuff7. Has support for 75Hz refresh rateThings that could have been improved(Cons ):1. Speaker volume is not that loud and lacks a punch of bass2. A little bit thicker(only slightly) when compared with some of latest models like acer which provides much thinner bezel

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2021
CommentsContent: Quarantine made me buy this monitor. I work on my laptop all day and the laptop font is too small and when I'm on client calls I need a second monitor to check my notes so I went ahead and bought this monitor. The speakers work well. Its a great extension screen. When I used the monitor alone I did find a lag but I connect it to my laptop and use it as an extension screen which has no lag at all. The display is pretty decent and I get great use off it. The screen is huge, easy to assemble and has helped me multitask. I stopped writing notes in a notebook after buying this monitor. It also comes with a HDMI cable. No need to buy one. For this price and monitor size you won't get anything better considering its a notable brand and I say this after checking so many monitors cheaper or in the same range on Amazon.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2021
CommentsContent: Brightness and picture quality is good. Adjusting volume requires going through too many buttons so I keep it at 100% all the time and adjust the volume via my laptop's volume. Very happy this comes with the HDMI cord.Assembly for the stand was tricky. You have slide in the metal part of the staff into the bottom part for it to click, and it wasn't clear from the instructions. If you do that, it's easy. I wish the monitor had a greater range of height adjustment, it's too short to work with a laptop in front of so I have to put the monitor on top of a box to use it with my laptop. I haven't been able to use it vertically because it disconnects from the power cord too easily. Good for price.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2021
CommentsContent: I haven't used a desktop monitor in some years and it will take me some time to adjust to the more basic features of this one. For the price, it does the job quite well, but cannot compare with the clarity, etc. that one finds on laptop monitors. The colors seems reasonably accurate and the brightness (250 nits) is adequate but usually has to be kept at the maximum level. This is certainly not a gaming monitor.If you buy this monitor to use it with a desktop PC for office work, it will do the job but you could probably do better if you spend a bit more. Letters, for example, are not all that crisp on the screen and while easily readable, you might find them a bit thin/dull and not having enough brightness.The features of the monitor are basic. If you wish to place a webcam on top of it, you would need one with a less bulky clamp. I used the following: https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B086GQSKK3/ and it fit perfectly, the clamp staying just above the screen area.Being able to adjust easily the monitor height is a plus and installation was easy. Overall - this is a decent budget monitor that doesn't spark or dazzle but does the job fine.

CommentsTitle: Solid Monitor-Mac Mini M1 Audio Issue
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 7, 2021
CommentsContent: This is a solid, good-quality value monitor. Bought it to use w/ a new Mac M1 and the audio volume could not be controlled through the Apple keyboard keys, only on screen w/ cursor. When using the built-in monitor speakers through HDMI or DisplayPort just the same error message: "The selected device has no output controls." 6 hours on support chat and phone with 4 different Apple/Mac reps could not solve the problem. All other audio devices - wired earbuds, bluetooth external speaker - work fine and the keyboard audio controls work. Just not with this monitor using the built-ins. It just does not seem to be compatible with the Mac Mini M1 in this regard. Really inconvenient having to manually adjust audio on screen with mouse and cursor in whatever app is playing audio, iTunes, YouTube, Netflix, whatever. Having to return this monitor that is otherwise acceptable and get another brand with a USB-C port and hope it works. If you have a Mac Mini M1 2020 this might not be the monitor for you if you want volume control from the keyboard. The monitor itself has no external manual volume control. I'd be cautious if you had any M1 Mac and are considering this screen.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 18, 2020
CommentsContent: This monitor is great! Picture quality and brightness are super. There's quite a few brightness settings for customization - good for tweaking to your likeness. Can't think of anything bad to say about this display, especially considering how inexpensive it is. Sounds like some people have had trouble with getting a dud, or damaged screen. But mine came in perfect working condition. In fact, I'd like to get another one to replace my older monitor, as I'm running a dual monitor setup with this new HP monitor and my older Acer monitor, and the older monitor just doesn't come close to the quality of my new one. I'm using desktop speakers so I'm not using the internal monitor speakers, but I know it does have speakers (I've seen a few reviews from people saying it doesn't have built speakers?) as I just ran a speaker test and they worked just fine. The only minor issue I could say I had is the monitor stand is pretty beefy with a good size footprint, and I was trying to put this on a fairly small desk, so had to make some adjustments, but again, this was minor.

CommentsTitle: Awesome monitor but may not be 75hz
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 28, 2020
CommentsContent: Amazing monitor speakers are great sounds good using for extra console gaming monitor everything is amazing colors, brightness, nice and sharp 1080p very cool easy to lift and tilt I highly recommend I'm just playing on console and can't take advantage of 75z but it seems to only to be 60hz no where on the box or monitor it says 75hz anywhere not as advertised or else I'd give it full 5 stars I will be keeping it for sure we'll worth the money

CommentsTitle: Excellent monitor for a fantastic price!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2021
CommentsContent: I got this on sale for $109 and am super pleased! I love the thin bezels and the adjustability. I really wanted a monitor that could be height and tilt adjusted and possibly rotated but most monitors with these capabilities are $150-$200. I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the speakers as well. Many monitors that I looked at with the built-in speakers had complaints about terrible sound so I was worried about these but where they may not be the best I think they're great! The color and brightness looks great. It was super easy to set up, just connect pieces and no screws/screwdriver required. I have not tried with this with heavy gaming, I mostly use it for work which is analyzing data and reading papers.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 18, 2021
CommentsContent: I ordered this monitor to add to my existing system as a second monitor under Windows 10.  It is a good looking monitor with very thin bezels on the top and sides.  The bottom has a bigger bezel with the HP logo and power light.  It is a very stark and pleasant difference compared to my older Dell monitor that has a thick bezel on all sides.The picture quality is good but not super.  I can compare it directly with my Dell monitor that sits right next to it.  I see the difference in sharpness as I drag any app from one screen to the other.  The Dell monitor is sharp and precise while the HP seems a bit fuzzier.  This is especially apparent at higher resolution with small text.  For anything else, it really is a good monitor (especially for the price).  Pictures look good and watching videos is also a good experience.The brightness is excellent does not get washed out, even with sunlight coming in the window.  The range between pure white and black is also very good.  Overall a good monitor for general usage and for business apps.  I don't play many games, so I can't comment on the response time of the monitor.

CommentsTitle: Great quality low cost monitors! Buy this, seriously!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 3, 2020
CommentsContent: WFH on this monitor for 8-10 hours a day. Bought 2, should have bought 3. Two months so far and I LOVE THIS MONITOR. Easy to set up, beautiful colors, a plethora of input options and a clean thin bezel design on 3 edges. VESA mount plays nice with my stands. I tested the speakers and they’ll do in a pinch, but if you want high quality sound, use earbuds or decent speakers. Buy this! HP hit a home run with this monitor!

CommentsTitle: Don't buy this monitor for the built in speakers. Buy it for the amazing image quality.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 19, 2020
CommentsContent: The monitor us a wonderful upgrade to my VGA 21 inch monitor.Overall visual design 5 stars.Speakers, and yes it has speakers. 1 star for size and placement. Use the monitor MENU to find AUDIO and adjust built in volume.If you are not using DP to DP as I am you may not have sound. Included with this monitor is a 3.5 to 3.5mm jumper cable. One end goes into the sound  out from the back of your desktop to the input of this monitor. Then you shall have a small amount of sound.Honestly, who places speakers facing the back. And, they are ridiculously small. The area they are in may be able to support much larger speakers.Sound quality is about like your phone on speaker only in stereo. The speaker size is about 1 inch or so. Facing back makes zero sense.If you look on the lower rounded back side you see where grills are. The tiny holes are where the speakers are.Do not buy this monitor for the built in speakers. They flat out suck.As for the picture/image on screen this is a fantastic monitor. 5 Stars.Recommendation: Yes.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 23, 2020
CommentsContent: I’ve been looking for two monitors since COVID made me(and probably majority of Corporate America) become WFH Bound till god knows how long. Then came these two monitors. The moment I saw that they were back in stock I hurried up and bought two and Im so glad I did! GREAT PICTURE QUALITY and the speakers built in have good sound quality(although I prefer my MacBook Pro Speakers and only use those). Makes my work load so much easier and faster instead of using my MacBook Pro monitor and a monitor someone let me borrow.If you are thinking about getting this monitor, GRAB IT ASAP BEFORE THEY SELL OUT AGAIN!!!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2021
CommentsContent: Product: HP 24mh - 24 inch 1080p ips monitor.For the money, this is a really excellent monitor. I bought this because I needed a monitor for a 2-month stint working away from my regular "office", and I didn't want to spend much money for a short term need. I'm very impressed with how far my money stretched with this product.I'm mostly familiar with working with Dell Ultrasharp monitors, which are a higher-end product. A dell ultrasharp of the same size/resolution costs twice as much as this. For half the price, I would judge this HP monitor to have 90-95% as good a screen quality. It's clear, easy to look at, and not reflective at all. The colors are bright and there don't appear to be obvious limits to color gamut. Some cheap displays I've used have whacky blues/greens/yellows, but this monitor doesn't have any such problems.The build and stand feel like great quality, with sturdy mechanisms to assemble and move the screen around. If I had to pick one flaw, it would be that the stand seems to transmit a few vibrations from the table, resulting in the screen shaking when I'm typing too vigorously. This certainly won't affect my work, but for those who wish to furiously bash a keyboard while gaming, you might want a slightly more sturdy product.Ultimately, I've used similarly-priced displays with MUCH worse screens than this. So if you want quality without spending a lot, this is a great choice.

CommentsTitle: No way to easily control volume
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 19, 2020
CommentsContent: I primarily bought this monitor so I don't have to use another speaker, first thing this product advertises is Built-In Speakers, but they leave out the basic volume control button, even the onscreen volume control is hidden somewhere down the menu, this is a complete deal-breaker.

CommentsTitle: Overall I like it, but I personally have a few issues.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 19, 2021
CommentsContent: Let's start with the pros!-The size is good, I think it looks pretty, it's clear, has decently good speakers, can be turnt sideways, and is decent for gaming. I bought this primarily as a budget gaming monitor and to use it while I'm streaming games on Twitch.-Not too expensive-Nice looking standCons-Whenever I play any dark game like Skyrim, or see a dark loading screen from a game, I unfortunately see yellow bleeding on the sides. It's been there since Day 1. I most likely will exchange it for a new one if I can find a solution for my second issue. I really needed a monitor for streaming, so I don't have time to go days without a monitor again. This monitor does have a warranty, so I'll have to contact HP at some point if it really starts to bug me while playing games like Skyrim.-I cannot connect my Nintendo Wii. I've tried contacting HP support but no one knows the answer so far and I get an error every time I plug in my Wii saying that I need to "change the mode" when there is no option to change the mode. I was really looking forward to streaming switch and Wii games but I haven't found a solution for the Wii games yet although Switch games are fine... if I don't, I may have to get a BENQ or some other type of gaming monitor that is more compatible with different gaming systems.Besides that, it's great! The height adjustment is AMAZING, I LOVE that it has speakers, and it has the ports that I need! Another HDMI would be nice, but it's okay. Main problems were just the bleeding and not being able to connect my Wii. If I find a solution for my Wii I'll update this review!-@LeSweetpea on Twitch, IG, and YouTube

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2021
CommentsContent: Perfect for school, work. A vast improvement over my previous monitor. Takes same space, but wider image, lighter, fast refresh good for streaming, I do not know if this is good enough for high quality gaming.I really like the two speakers in the back, which work via hdmi cable or 3.5mm aux cable. Speakers are better than laptop, but not great. Still, having that option is really nice touch. Controls are easy enough to figure out, they're on the bottom of the display.Very light, easy to install, recommended monitor.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2021
CommentsContent: Very nice! So happy with the first, I immediately bought a second! Both arrived with no dead pixels, brand new, well packaged. Worked right out of the box as advertised, though be advised you should download the drivers from the HP website.Picture quality is great, no issues with light bleed through, good menu system, sound quality decent for economical rear mounted speakers.Surprisingly lightweight off the stand - I mounted both to a dual monitor stand with 100 mm VESA mounts.Also glad of the VGA, HDMI and Displayport ports.  I installed a Geforce GT 1030 video card with HDMI and Displayport ports, plugged both monitors in to the card, updated drivers, and bam, instant extended dual monitors.Note these monitors only have one Displayport, not separate input and output ports, so you can't daisy chain them like the newer Displayport models.Very happy with the purchases!

CommentsTitle: Very very basic quality product, got what I spent quality
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 4, 2020
CommentsContent: I have been using hp's monitor for long time now. I thought I can spend a little less to get the same quality hp monitor that i'm using at work. Nope, this is no where near to my expectation regarding the flimsiness and picture quality. Built-in speakers are faced on back side. Supposed to bounce sound by wall like tv. But unlike TV monitors can have a different setup. Monitor resolution is 1080 but the pictures does not look good at all. I spent $200 to get two monitors where I should have spent same amount to get ONE better monitor.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 31, 2021
CommentsContent: This is a nice monitor and looks appealing. Connected easily to my MacBook using a USB-C to DisplayPort cable. However the image on monitor, with all the appropriate settings adjusted, is not so great. Im not sure if Im accustomed to Apple's Retina display or what. It's great having a huge screen without purchasing a $1,000 iMac though. I'm using a bluetooth keyboard/mouse combo and keep my laptop in "clam-closed" under my desk. But I really have to sit about 4' away before the pixilation gets better, especially on text and reading. If you're using a Mac, you can have the DisplayPort transfer audio (so you don't have to use the headphone wire) just go into the sound settings. Only issue with that is the native volume controls don't work, you have to use the volume slider within the respective apps.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 3, 2020
CommentsContent: Got to replace older Acer monitor. Purchased this based upon low blue light &75 hz rate. Hardest part on set-up out if box was connecting 2 piece monitor stand. If have trouble getting metal plate's lip in, tip the base almost 90 degrees to plate lip & lift/slide lip in.  That typed, however, it's remarkablely easy setup & a "plug-n-play" monitor. 3 buttons on bottom right monitor side allow manual settings adjustment if you don't want to fiddle with one's graphics card software. My NVIDIA card works great with it & got my game settings perfectly on monitor.  Came with 3 cords, power, HDMI, sound.  For the reviews complaints on sound, it's just like any other monitor sound.  Why complain when like 90% of us use headsets or run sound through sound bars seems like a stupid, trivial thing. It's a great monitor for the price

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2021
CommentsContent: I've been using monitors my company provided me that were very old. I work from home and didn't feel like spending money on something I use for work. I regret I didn't buy these earlier. I just one one to try it out, and bought another after setting it up. The good monitor my company provided doesn't look nearly as good. The price point is perfect, shipping was quick. I'm not using it for gaming, just work and IT classes. Did stream on it to test and it looks perfect.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 10, 2021
CommentsContent: Had the Hp 24mh 75 hz 1080p non gaming monitor for 2 days.  So far so good. Bought for wife replacing an all in one computer. The HP PC we are using has AMD gpu with displayport (DP). The monitor does also. Connect the DPC from your PC/laptop if it has one to the DP on the HP monitor and you get 75Hz refreash rate. HDMI cable you get gives you 60hz.DPC does not come with the Monitor. So the total cost for me was $122.00. Worth it. Great colors. If you are mainly using for work, Play older games or internet games, this HP is fantastic. #1 monitor sold on Amazon. I can see why. Perfect for my non gamer wife.60hz vs 75hz refreash. Why not use the best setting that the monitor can do. Will make videos/movies flow better. Enjoy monitor with a DPCable if you can!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 17, 2021
CommentsContent: Lightweight, minimal bezel, easy to get to the VESA mount (some are inset, behind covers, etc) no weird power supply just a standard computer plug, still has VGA, reasonably easy to get to ports and buttons, lots of adjustments! Too many low-end monitors remove all the features like this.Good speakers. Turns on reasonably fast, and saves last setting when turning back on. Really, really good picture quality, both when supplied over VGA and HDMI, for computer use, and motion video. Plenty of brightness.Is a bit tedious to switch inputs, and the control buttons are dyslexic; entirely backwards from any convention even other HP devices (like the pushbuttons they have on printers), and uses some weird symbols, also unlike their printer control panels.

CommentsTitle: Minimal to no customer support from HP
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2021
CommentsContent: The monitor arrived with minimal pictures re how to moubnt the monitor to the base. No instrructions or reference as to how to make any brightness adjustments or  picture sizing etc.  Amazon stepped up to the plate and providede contact info for HP support and followed up to make sure HP would respond.  I called HP and basically was told they were not interested in providing support for making monirtor adjustments.  The rep I talked to gave me a number to call in HP that would help for a fee. The tech did send a complete users guide via email. Why that was not at least for key adjustments wasn't included with the monitor is beyond me.  This monitor is now in operastion and working fine. It replaced an veey old HP monitor that was very old , but had all the appropriate iinstructions/tips. Hard to believe that HP saved enough money , by not putting some o simple how to start and set up basuic operation instructions in the  units packaging.  I sent HP a long note re my disappointment/concerns.  No response.Bottom line Amazon did all the right things re customer support. HP after my  spending too much time talking to "HP support" provided a detailed user guide, very disappointing support and  not even the courtesy of a note acknowledging my issues.

CommentsTitle: Great Bargain Monitor Except for Audio Quality
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 15, 2021
CommentsContent: Easy setup and great range of adjustability that is the best of any monitor I ever had.  Display is very good. The easily accessed monitor menu has many settings you can tweak. Came with HDMI cable and an audio cable to use from your PC audio out plug. Audio quality not so good but for the price speakers are good enough. They sound about like the speakers that came with the old PC's when you bought a kit with speakers, monitor etc. included.  I hooked up HDMI to my Dell PC, it worked but the sound was not very loud through HDMI via Intel Display Audio. My Dell also has Realtech HD Audio from the audio out jack so I used the included audio cable to the monitor and the sound is much louder. For the price it can't be beat. If you want better sound get a $40 sound bar and this monitor is still a bargain.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2021
CommentsContent: I got tired of hunching over my laptop - especially as my eyes are aging. Did a lot of research and this one kept coming back as a good choice. I've only had it a week, but I'm very happy. The setup was falling-off-a-log easy (just plug it in, basically). Everything comes in the box - no need to buy any cables or connections.All I have to do is get used to looking off to the side at the monitor, but I used to do that before I started using a laptop, so it's no big deal. I use it for Word and Excel doc, Canva designing and Photoshop Elements photo editing and happy with all of it. Especially nice to have the larger monitor when two of us need to look at something together. This one is big but not too big. Fits nicely on my desk. I'm not a gamer so I can speak to that.For $100-ish it's a great deal.

CommentsTitle: Really hits the sweet spot in every respect
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 11, 2020
CommentsContent: Ordered this for my wife who was working from home via Citrix on giant spreadsheets, virtualized in a "partial Excel clone" environment that wouldn't allow for either zooming or fast moves using keystroke combos.  She was ready to chuck the gig until I hooked this winner up.  Just a day and night difference in brightness, screen angle and of course screen real estate.  Now I'm the one jealous of her.The height adjustment is a terrific plus; both height and tilt adjustments are wide-range and robust.  The built-in speakers are a nice touch, rarely found at this price point.  Speaking of price, it's worth every penny of its modest cost. I couldn't find a single shortcoming and recommend this monitor highly as a system upgrade.

CommentsTitle: BRIGHT, CLEAR SCREEN, BUT SIZE INFO UNCLEAR
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2021
CommentsContent: Just received this replacement monitor and am very pleased with the clarity and brightness of the screen.  I can't give a comprehensive review, as I just installed it.  I do have one criticism, not of the monitor itself, but of the information in the description.  I wanted the largest screen that would fit in my somewhat limited space and the product information indicated that it was close to 19" tall.  That was the very limit of my space.  However, it is an adjustable height and can be reduced to as low as 15" from the base.  So, had I known that, I would have probably purchased a larger monitor.  The actual graphic shows a measurement of 18.28 " but the line showing this vertical size is only along the edge of the monitor, implying the screen itself is 18.28".  That is very misleading.  The advertisement does say it is adjustable in height, but does not give any dimensions.  Purchasing an item without being able to see it in person is difficult and often leads to returns and dissatisfaction. I think this information would be very valuable to include in future ads.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 8, 2021
CommentsContent: I bought this monitor in December and, since it worked so well, another one in January. I am using to teach (college) from home with Zoom, and it allows me to share one of the screens while keeping the attendees in the other.Connection was a breeze. If you have a dual setup in a mac you will need an HDMI to Thunderbolt / USB4.The monitor position is adjustable, both vertically and turning. The lowest possible height is really low (1.5 inches), which is very convenient for desktop setups: a monitor stand will increase your desktop real state.The screen in pleasantly brilliant, and works best with the factory setups. Good resolution (native 1920x1080). It is not 4K, but who needs 4K anyway? With a dual setup, only one of the HDMI monitors will play sound (at least with Mac), and the sound quality is underwhelming. The volume is not adjustable through the monitor settings, and the source volume only goes that far. If you plan to use this for video conference plan to use a headset or external speakers.In balance, an excellent value monitor.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2021
CommentsContent: Update 1/7/21: I was shipped a new unit. Now this screen only flashes white, green, blue and red when it's plugged in. The first one displayed find on my PC so I know it's not an issue with my PC. I know this is a first world problem but the fact that I've been shipped 2 faulty products back to back is ridiculous. Companies should not be allowed to sell garbage like this. I will not be purchasing any other HP products and I suggest that you don't either.Origional: This monitor arrived with a crack on the screen. There is also flecks of ripped plastic on the edges of the monitor which makes me think that this was a repackaged, used monitor. There is typically a plastic sheet that peals off the front of the monitor and this was was already pulled off. This is pretty disappointing to think that HP is selling used/damaged products.I have ordered a replacement. Until that arrives and works as intended I'm not happy with the purchase and expect more from HP.1 star until I receive the new product I paid for.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2021
CommentsContent: I just set up this monitor.  Factory setting has it on 60 hz but you can change it to 75 hz.  The speakers work well with my chromebook.  I was afraid the 24" would not be big enough since my vision is not the greatest, but it is plenty for my small office set up.  I use it to teach virtually. The true test will be after I use it in class this coming week.*I am not a gamer or big into to technology so I cannot attest to that.

CommentsTitle: Resolution issues.  Image won't fit on screen.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 25, 2020
CommentsContent: Bought this to use as a monitor with a Lenovo laptop.  Image displayed by monitor is about 10% too large so information is cropped from the edges.  Tried advanced scaling options but they only allow the image size to be increased further.  Monitor resolution is identical to laptop, although did attempt changes to resolution.  Scale and layout on both are identical. Tied both duplicate and extend display settings.  Connected the laptop to a Viewsonic monitor having identical settings and everything was fine.  Tried updating the driver to use HP's driver rather than the standard Win-10;  no difference.  Given previous experiences with HP products I was reticent to order this.  Now, I'm sorry that I did.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 20, 2020
CommentsContent: Claims it's 75 hz, it is not, it's 60 hz.  Also it does not have VESA Mounting.  I was trying to buy a monitor specifically for VESA mounting, now I need to buy an HP VESA adapter... I should have just spent more money on the initial monitor, now I'm stuck with a crappy screen and ended up paying more for crap monitor + VESA adapter than I would have originally.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 11, 2021
CommentsContent: The only thing I liked about this monitor is the price. Beware you get what you pay or here. I read the reviews and purchased this anyway. Speakers are very poor,very difficult to hear. If anyone was trying to use this for remote learning they would miss a lot of class time. The color was very poor. I tried to adjust it to no avail. The plug would  not stay in , fell out three times. I contacted HP customer service. Th specialist told me to turn off and turn back on. I set my volume  at 100% on the desktop . Still very low volume. I was informed by the specialist that was as loud as it would get. My broken monitor with no picture was louder. Anyone considering this monitor please read the reviews. The reviews I read said exactly the same as I am saying now.  Read reviews and payattention. Wish I had

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 25, 2020
CommentsContent: I ordered one of these to complement an older monitor that I already had, so that I could work from two monitors.  It was great!  I liked it so much, I decided to replace my old monitor and get another one of these.  The second one still has a great picture quality, but occasionally it goes black.  Doesn't matter if I'm working on it or it's sitting idle, the screen will go black and the speakers will stop working.  It really looks like it's turning itself off for a few seconds, then it starts up again.  It's a bit annoying, but I threw away the box so can't return it.  Pretty good quality for a reasonable price, if you get a good one.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2021
CommentsContent: At $110, I am very happy with this purchase.  It was easy to put the stand together & to affix the monitor & I was pleasantly surprised with the stand's height adjustment & tilting feature... Very sturdy & versatile.  It was packaged nicely, so be confident that it'll arrive unscathed.  It comes w/ a good length HDMI cable & power cable.  The built-in speakers work great (obviously not booming sound quality for video games, music, etc, but perfect for standard computer audio use).  The picture is bright & clear.  Absolutely no issues at all setting it up & connecting to the PC, and it worked great from the start.  I was bummed at first it wasn't 27", but after receiving it, it's perfect for my workspace... The screen doesn't seem too small at all.  You will not be disappointed with this purchase.

CommentsTitle: RMA Service was quick and easy but
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 12, 2020
CommentsContent: The first monitor came in broken (new one to arrive today) I will give Amazon credit they are quick to replace an item that comes in broken.  However I would wish they would use a reputable return shipping company.  Having an online scheduled pick up sounds great!  However after having the UPS guy come to my door stand there and then walk away is completely stupid.  When I contacted UPS I was told they are not required to ring the bell.  I guess I'm required to just know someone is standing at my door!! If this gets posted I'll repost once I have the new monitor and am able to test it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 26, 2021
CommentsContent: I recently decided I needed a few more monitors for some of the things I use my computer for daily like trading stocks and gaming. My video card supports up to 4 and I was currently using 2, an Alienware for my main screen and a different hp that is the same size as these.It took me awhile to sift through monitors because I dont exactly need anything crazy but I also don't want something cheap. Lo and behold I found these finally at the low end of the cost spectrum and they work perfectly!I'm not going to tell you like the colors and hues are special or anything or brightness or darkness is crazy. All I can say is that they were plug and play, mounted very easily, and look great. I can use each monitor for anything I do if i want like playing a game or watching a movie or watching the stock market....or all at once!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2021
CommentsContent: This is a nice monitor for the price. I had no problem running it at 75hz. I bought this mainly for running the new Microsoft flight simulator. It works well for that thought I do notice a little bit of backlight bleed in the corners in dark night flying.  The stand is bit more bulkier than it should be but it does make it feel sturdy. Speakers are only ok but better than nothing. Sounds better against a wall because they are backfiring. You're better off getting some bluetooth speakers. I didn't see any other monitors at this price point with speakers so that's a plus. One star off for the backlight bleed.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 28, 2020
CommentsContent: Wow! nearly perfect monitor for the price.  Low blue light mode, speakers, portrait capable, up/down height.  The only missing feature is that it can't rotate on its base left/right.  This is important because I can't square off the stand with my desk edge, and rotate the monitor left/right for someone else to view next to me.  I have to get up and move the whole monitor and base.  Other than that, it's perfect for the price!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 18, 2021
CommentsContent: Easy location to reach for switches for power etc.  Rimless and good size for a desktop - not too large. Only has HDMI input - nice if it had the VGA too for use on older computers - it would be a bust to  buy this as a replacement for an older one only to find out it won't plug in. No problems here as it is used with a new BeelinkGT18 I got with it. It tilts and adjust up and down for placement in tight quarters. Has a somewhat long power supply (wall wart) that will take at least 2 spaces or more depending on outlet orientation.  very sharp crisp video - great for photographic work and retouching. Still getting use to W-10 O.S. though.

CommentsTitle: Received a bad one and had to replace
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 5, 2020
CommentsContent: I ordered the monitor to have a better home office. The monitor came with a small speaker which is an added bonus. Although the monitor has a displayport, it comes with a HDMI cable not displayport. One of the corners is dark and it is visibly dark so not sure if the monitors are tested during manufacture.  I have attached some pictures. I tried switching to a different port, using my own HDMI cable, plugging into another port so ruled out the possibilities. Amazon will have to replace or I have to return. Disappointed with you HP.Update: I got a replacement from Amazon which works perfectly. Still not 5 stars for the initial bad experience.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 12, 2020
CommentsContent: I work in user experience and improving a customer's 'out of the box' experience. This monitor and its packaging were truly a user's delight. It took me exactly 90 seconds to get this baby up and running. The user guide was so easy to follow. The monitor itself is lightweight but packs in an excellent display. The speakers are such a joy. I can actually handle work calls without a headset. The low light display setting at night is beautiful. My only issue is that I could raise the monitors to position them above my line of sight (ideal for minimal neck/eye strain) but thankfully, my standing desk comes in handy for this purpose. If you are ever remotely considering this monitor, think no more. Just get it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2021
CommentsContent: I needed a second monitor to make working from home easier, because of switching back and forth between spreadsheets and several different programs at once.  This was an inexpensive option which works perfectly for what I needed.  The size is right, the price is right, and it was easy to set up when following the instructions.  I ran into a little issue with the sound not working through the telephone headset on the primary monitor, but coming out of the speakers on the secondary monitor, but with a phone call to IT, that issue was easily corrected.  This is a great monitor, thanks!

CommentsTitle: Showing signs of discoloration in the screen image - and one dead pixel
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2021
CommentsContent: A little disappointed with this monitor. I bought two of them back in November 2020 around the holidays. After a about a month of daily use for work, I started to notice a slight discoloration in the image of one monitor. The screen started to have a reddish hue to it despite having adjusted both monitors to have the same image/color settings. I tried adjusting the colors but the reddish/pinkish hue was still discrete I left. I had high hopes for this monitor, being an HP product and all, and really wanted to like it. Although the other monitor was ok, I’ve decided to return both (after reading the other reviews posted after I bought these) since I don’t want to wait for the other monitor to show signs of discoloration just after return period expires on January 31, 2021. No wonder the price was relatively cheap. I hope you will not have the same experience that I’ve had. I will update this review once I turn them both on when I return to work on Monday and show a picture of what I’m talking about.Update: 1/4/21: uploaded a picture of the reddish/pinkish hue on the screen on the left

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2021
CommentsContent: sure the monitor works as it should, but i bought the model with the built in speakers. I wanted to connect my iPod up and play music as I play games or work on spreadsheets.that's a BIG NO GO. I'm not sure id the HDMI port has something to do with it but I can't get any sound out of the monitor's built in speakers. HP website will show all about the Monitor and it's functions but NOTHING about the sound NOT working.would I buy another one?  NOwould I recommend this monitor?  only if all you want is a monitor.for the money,  just get a monitor with-out the speakers.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 13, 2020
CommentsContent: There are speakers in this monitor.  I have no idea why people are saying there are not.  This is a simple plug and play monitor.  I used two of these monitors for the kids new virtual work space, thrilled I had to spend money for my kids public educations... but I digress.  Quality and sound is great, monitor tilts and the height is adjustable.  Keep in mind if you are using this with a chrome book the only connection to the monitor is an HDMI.  I had to buy a USB-C to HDMI adapter ($10) for it to connect.  Simple fix though, and a win that this monitor comes with a HDMI.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2021
CommentsContent: I didnt purchase this for gaming, I needed a second monitor for working at home but my husband has snatched it after my work hours to play his PS5 on. Picture has great quality! I would def purchase again. The only thing I dislike is how hard it is to utilize the volume control. A simple up/down button would be preferable, rather than going through the settings.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2021
CommentsContent: I ordered 3 because I am now working from home as a component designer I love these monitors they are crisp and clean and do not get smudged as easy. I received these last wednesday (2/10) I installed all three on my mount then turned them on to find one of the screens were broke. I filled out the replacement and rather it is amazon's settings or this companies I am very happy my replacement just arrived today monday (2/15). The replacement process was fast and easy i put the old broke one back in the box and went to ups and the scanned the code amazon gave me and thursday morning i received a notification that my replacement screen had shipped before i was even able to get the return in the mail. Before anyone says 4 days is not fast i live in the middle of nowhere wyoming and we have got a lot of snow. sorry for the length of this review but i needed to be said that this company stands behind their product and will do what they can to make things right and these are great monitors and quite large about 21"x13".

CommentsContent: For the value, there’s Lots to like about this monitor which I use for work, no gaming. But I am returning it because it is too dark. The brightness level on the monitor (left) is currently set at 100 and you can see it is not nearly as bright as my 2020 MacBook.Mounting it to my vesa compatible mount was very easy however.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 26, 2020

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2021
CommentsContent: I purchased two of these monitors at separate times as I was building my home office set up. For the price, it is a great monitor. I love that it telescopes and I like the size. My largest complaints: 1. it has a very warm color quality which I had to get used to and bugged me for a bit as it seemed very yellow. There may be a way to fix it, but I'm not a tech pro and haven't found an easy way. The first monitor I ordered is fitted correctly though.

CommentsTitle: arrived early and in perfect condition
