CommentsContent: monitor arrived before tower,,lol,first off,every piece was wrapped individually with foam and tape,not a scratch or smear on anything,so I hooked it up to my laptop as test(with hdmi cord).I did not adjust anything (just plug and play)picture was crisp and colors were warm and vivid.I cant really give a review on the speakers,,I dont have alot of background noise like most people,so,I look for sound quality over loudness.and screen is tucked in corner so sound is radiating up and down .the odd thing is when I first started watching episodes on funimation,yes,,they DID sound like normal laptop speakers.but after a couple of episodes,I noticed the sound quality improved(no more laptop sound)but I dont know if my hearing adjusted to speakers or if laptop updated something and improved speakers,,I did not adjust or touch anything,,,am more than thrilled either way

CommentsTitle: Never thought I needed a monitor until this one!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2021
CommentsContent: I have a 2019 MacBook Pro and wanted a bigger screen for watching soccer on Fubo, and this one has been perfect. It was a cinch to set up and has had no connection issues. Picture quality is great, although my MacBook is a touch better but the retina is hard with which to compete.Overall, for the price, this was a stupendous deal!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 10, 2020
CommentsContent: Nice bright crisp sharp screen. Many complain about speakers. It all depends on the quality of the recording itself. For my purposes, like a YT video or background music it's fine. Had troubles to connect the HDMI. The socket is recessed and facing down. Then realized the screen actually rotates to the portrait mode and then it's much easier. Still, they could've placed those sockets facing the user to eliminate extra guesswork. Can't get it why they still keep slapping the VGA port on? How many people have it in the computer still? Even those few who do then just by an adapter for a few bucks. This port is really a waste. But I see this is not only HP. I wish I could get an answer why they still do it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2021
CommentsContent: I recently upgraded my workstation to a 4 monitor setup and needed one more monitor. This one fit the bill nicely. Some folks said there are no speakers, but they are definitely there, although they face toward the back. I have it connected via hdmi and I can send audio to the speakers if I choose to (Linux).I opted to use a separate monitor pedestal for 2 monitors, that allows you to swivel for portrait/landscape layout. It also allows you to adjust the height of the 2 slightly different monitors so they line up nicely.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2021
CommentsContent: I personally use the monitor in combination with my MacBook as an office setup but when I attached my ps4 it was perfect. It has 3 ports (VGA, HDMI, and DisplayPort) so, you can use it for many different things for example I have the monitor in use for my work and as an office setup in the morning, and later at night I plug my ps4 in it and its perfect for gaming. There are so many settings on the monitor itself and you can virtually change everything from the color to brightness to volume to refresh rate. It defaulted at 60Hz so make sure to change it to 75Hz when gaming. It's 1920x1080 and it is very hard to see the pixels unless ur face is touching the monitor. One flaw with this type of monitor is that you need to be looking at the monitor headon with no angle or else the colors distort. Another flaw is that the speakers are on the back so, the sound is muffled and you have to turn it up. Or else it is big, perfect quality, loud, and bright,

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 14, 2021
CommentsContent: I recently bought 2 of these and a dual monitor stand to replace my old monitor and an old TV set I was using as a monitor.  These are really nice monitors.  You can also set them so the irritating LED lights don't come on.  This is very useful if your office is in your bedroom or somewhere else you don't want LED lights always on.  Resolution is good and screens are nice and don't burn your eyes.  Dual monitor stand works great with them and the frame is very thin on the sides so it appears as 1 monitor if you extend your desktop.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 12, 2020
CommentsContent: For those of you complaining about the quality monitor’s audio, it comes out of the box set at 50%. Use the buttons on the bottom right if the screen to adjust the volume to 100%. The audio quality is great. I tested it out for myself. It’s loud and much better than what i’ve read in the reviews. I’m waiting to set them up to my docking station and then i’ll do a thorough review but so far, very good.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2021
CommentsContent: I needed a replacement 24 inch for my desk, and initially ordered a different brand, curved 24. The curve was OK, not life changing or all that cool, but it was OK. That monitor however, would NOT wake up after going to sleep with my PC. I tried power settings, I tried all that vendor suggested online, no help. I got tired of having to power off the PC and back on just to WAKE UP THE MONITOR, I returned it and bought this.Best decision ever. Flat, beautiful picture, IT WAKES UP every time, just like it should.

CommentsTitle: Great monitor but NOT 75hz refresh rate
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 21, 2021
CommentsContent: While I still think this is an excellent monitor for the price buyer beware, this is NOT a 75hz refresh monitor!  After using the monitor, checking the user guide, manufacturer site, and engaging through live support with Amazon this is in fact not a 75hz refresh rate monitor.  It is only 60hz.With that being said.  If you are looking for a cheap, excellent monitor for something as simple as work then pull the trigger.  I am considering a second one.  Now do you want to use this monitor for graphic design or gaming? No.  Spreadsheets and email?  Yes. Speakers are a nice touch, nothing special, they are just monitor speakers.  Decent amount of inputs.  Adjustable easy to remove stand.  Monitor works on my Vivo dual monitor stand without any modifications.  I have it currently setup up as a vertical standing monitor and it has been working great.  Despite the free returns and the misleading information I have decided to keep the monitor.  The next price point for better monitors is not something I am willing to shell out my money to get for my simple needs.The reason the item received a 3 star rating is the description.  It is misleading in multiple places for the refresh rate and after pointing out the issue to Amazon the description has not been updated.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2021
CommentsContent: I got this after my husbands continued insisting that I get a new monitor for my home computer. It is clear in picture quality.

CommentsTitle: A 75 Hz, 1080p IPS display for $109.99? What value!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 9, 2020
CommentsContent: Seriously, my main monitor is an ACER one that is tailored to gaming, 144hz, IPS display with 99% sRGB Color-accuracy, Gsync/Freesync compatible, etc, and while this display may not have all of those amenities, for literally a third of the cost, you have a monitor that visually, is virtually identical in terms of fidelity and quality. I cannot recommend this product enough at it's price-point, I use this solely in Portrait mode and love having it as a high-quality, budget-friendly second option, however, the one thing I will note is that you will have to manually set that 75 Hz refresh rate yourself. At least, I had to!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 15, 2021
CommentsContent: I added this monitor to my new laptop computer in place of its smaller screen and it has worked very well and made seeing documents much easier. CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 15, 2020
CommentsContent: Very good price for a good quality monitor.  Picture quality are decent for gaming.  The best feature is that you can adjust the height level of the monitor, while a lot of other brands couldn't.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2021
CommentsContent: I got monitor to use with a laptop while working from home. It was easy to set up and the windows 10 pc laptop installed it immediately. Using the included HDMI cable to connect it was a breeze. The image quality is very crisp and clear. It is set up in an area right next to a window, but the brightness of this monitor is really good, so there have been no issues seeing what is on screen. The built in speakers sound clear when used for conference calls (which is a huge plus because the laptop speakers are garbage and I prefer not wearing a headset or headphones all day for work). This monitor is a great investment if you’re in the market. I would definitely recommend it.

CommentsTitle: Inexpensive and great for the price.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 1, 2020
CommentsContent: I started working from home and the monitor (one) that my work sent me home with was not gonna cut it. I read some reviews which made me second guess my purchase. Screen bleed is what I read but I'm not seeing that at all. I love how you can adjust the height and angel on the screens. You can even run them sideways. You can also use VGA, HDMI and Display port to connect them to your computer. Oh yeah by the way, I did not by these for sound so I did not connect the cord. Sound it not what I bought these for.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2021
CommentsContent: What this monitor is: a good general purpose monitor for document editing, email and web-browsing, or as a secondary monitor when you need a bit more screen space, which is my primary usage.  Especially at it's price point, it provides good value for general use.What it is not: a monitor for serious gaming, video or image editing.The controls provide a good deal of adjustment for image quality, tone and brightness, with menus that were easy enough to navigate to find what I wanted.  The "Low Blue Light," "Night" and "Reading settings are a plus.  Even if the out-of-the-box settings are your preferences, the adjustments are there.  Blacks could be darker, and the images a bit sharper, but the overall brightness and contrast are acceptable for general viewing.The sound is fine for general listening, whether music or videos on the web.  It's not quite as crisp and clear as the speakers on my high-end laptop, but are more than adequate for listening to news or podcasts on the web, or for some music while you work.The stand is a plus, sturdy, and adjustable for both height and tilt.  More surprising at this price was the option to rotate the screen for portrait orientation, which I occasionally need to do, and my reason for selecting this particular monitor.  That feature isn't common in this range, but made this purchase worthwhile.Overall, a very good value monitor with a strong feature set at a very affordable price.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 25, 2020
CommentsContent: Got this monitor in and was impressed was a replacement for a expensive Sceptre monitor which died overnight with a screen problem which the manufacturer would not cover which I paid triple the cost for and this one is much clearer than that one and no dead pixels. The base is very solid unlike some other budget models so it won't just fall down easily like others.Update:Dead Pixel started appearing now. Can't get refund now because of deadline. Hope HP will Help now.

No DP/VGA cable.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 17, 2021
CommentsContent: I work in IT and have experience with many low-budget monitors. This one is not worth the price.The main problem I have with this monitor is the image quality--it is one of the worst IPS displays I have seen.Even after tweaking settings, the quality of the image is still not what I would consider acceptable for the price.Another negative is the screen brightness, while it is suitable for general use, the display is surprisingly dim (especially for an IPS panel), and you may experience difficulty using it in an environment with direct sunlight.I am surprised by the number of positive reviews for this monitor, considering I have used many other FHD IPS monitors at this price point that make this one's image quality inexcusable in comparison.

CommentsTitle: Used primarily as 2nd monitor for Nintendo Switch
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 18, 2021
CommentsContent: I bought this as a 2nd monitor next to my main desktop computer monitor to use for playing on my Switch from the comfort of my desk and occasionally as a 2nd PC monitor for Discord/Browser tabs/etc. So far it has fulfilled my needs.Picture quality is not as good as my main monitor, an AOC 2367, but it does the job (you get what you pay for). The built-in speakers are good enough for when I play Smash or Animal Crossing on my Switch, I don't need studio-level audio quality for those kinds of games. PLEASE PLEASE USE THE "HP ENHANCE +" COLOR SETTING FOR CONSOLE GAMES! Trust me, you won't regret it. That option made all my Switch games look so much better, it instantly increased the value of the monitor by like $50.Overall I'm happy with my purchase so far, we'll see how long it lasts and I'll update this review if there are any drastic changes.

CommentsTitle: An Amazing Monitor that is Worth the Price
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2021
CommentsContent: I have had this monitor for a few days and from the moment I pulled it out of the box I have loved it.  I love the large, vivid, and matte display.  The stand for this monitor is even great.  It can adjust vertically and tilt up and down.  On top of that, you can turn the monitor to a portrait layout.  Everything is well polished and worth more than the price.  This monitor is well worth the price and is a great deal when it comes to the $100 I spent on it at the time.  If you are looking for a medium sized monitor, buy this without hesitation.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 11, 2021
CommentsContent: I connected this to my Dell XPS with an NVIDIA GeForce GT 635 video card and my Night Owl HD CMS software would blink (as if it was being turned off and on rapidly) when I mixed hi-res and low-res cameras on the same display screen.  I found on YouTube the solution.  Right click on the desktop, select NVIDIA Control Panel, select "adjust desktop color settings" and change "content type reported to the display" to other than auto-select.  Now it works perfectly.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 1, 2021
CommentsContent: I liked this monitor and thought it was decent for the price until the a black line appeared down the middle of the monitor on the 31st day.  I know even quality new products fail occasionally so no big deal I just need to contact HP to get it repaired/replaced as it is still under warranty.That is where the problem began.  They quickly agreed it was defective and agreed to replace it.  They said they would send me packaging and a return label and once they received it they would send out a replacement.  I asked if they could send out a replacement immediately if I put a credit card on file so I would not have to be without a monitor for an extended period and they said they could not do that.  OK. I will just have to live without for the 8-10 days they quoted.It has now been 13 days since they started the return process and it is still showing a status of "Preparing shipping materials"  I contacted HP support after 10 days and they said they would send a note to the team responsible to get it moving along and they would keep me updated on progress.  I still have not received any additional information and it is still in the same state.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2021

CommentsTitle: Like a window into another dimension

CommentsContent: This monitor is amazing.To be fair, my previous monitor was absolute $#!+, so perhaps I'm just giddy from the fact I can actually see things now. But so far so good!Great job, HP. Maybe now I'll forgive you for beating us on that contract years ago.

CommentsTitle: Worth the $100 but not much more

I'm not a computer expert, so I may be user error.  If you're not a computer expert either, then it is helpful to know this process.

CommentsTitle: HOW TO USE BUILT IN SPEAKERS AND HOW TO CHANGE AUDIO VOLUME
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 14, 2020
CommentsContent: Some people said there are no built-in speakers. That's because you need to change the sound output settings on your computer:- Mac OS: Apple icon --> System Preferences --> Sound --> Output --> select HP 24mh- Windows: In the monitor menu, go to Management --> Audio --> check PC Analog Audio (based on another review)To change audio volume:1. Press any of the buttons next to the start button of the monitor twice.2. Use the arrows and icons to navigate the menu to Management --> Audio --> Volume3. You can also change volume settings on most video/audio playing apps.Remember that if you computer doesn't have an HDMI port, you will need to buy a separate adapter! For Mac laptops:1. Identify the model of your Mac2. Check what port it has by going to this website: https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT2017363. Buy an adapter that transmit from your port to HDMI (not the other way around). Check the product description to see if the adapter is compatible with your laptop. For example, this adapter works well with my early 2015 Macbook Air:https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07JDWR6W9/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o02_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=14. Plug the HDMI end of the adapter into the HDMI cable that comes with this monitor, and plug the other end of the adapter into your laptop.5. Then press the start button on the monitor to turn it on.6. If needed, change audio and volume settings as above.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 16, 2020
CommentsContent: Bought this as a gift for my mother to replace a much older 22" Dell monitor. It's much nicer than I thought it was going to be. 24" very thin bezel, hooked right up to VGA port on her PC and was ready to go. The speakers sound good for back-facing monitor speakers. They are not audiophile quality but perform fine when listening to music and/or talk programs at a reasonable volume. For those who don't know, the speakers default setting is 50%, you have to go through the tedious menus on the monitor to increase them to 100%. Not only does this monitor tilt up or down, but the height can be adjusted by pushing or pulling the whole screen up or down. This is a great feature I have not seen on more expensive monitors. Overall my mom is very happy and that makes me very happy. Good buy.

CommentsTitle: The refresh rate is not 75Hz. False advertising.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 7, 2020
CommentsContent: It's 60Hz, not the 75Hz as advertised. The instruction manual says 60Hz, the manufacturer's website says 60Hz, and if you try to change the settings it only gives you two options: 50Hz ad 60Hz. Overall a good value for the price of $109, but it's inconvenient and unfair to be lied to. Huge waste of time. If you are looking for 75Hz, buy a different product.

CommentsTitle: PLEASED! Easy Set-up, Nice Picture, Sound, cords Included and tilts.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2021
CommentsContent: I use this as a second monitor. I like that it doesn't need a stand as the base and length of the "neck" is long. My other monitor needs to be up on a stand so together, they match up.  The tilting and bigger viewing angles were also important. I couldn't see how the height could adjust but I didn't need it to be higher so I didn't keep looking.  There were no assembly instructions in my box but it was intuitive. Screw the base to neck then slide/attach the monitor. It came with 3 cords and I only required the 2 (power and hdmi).  The sound quality is fine, nothing special. I really like it and glad I chose this monitor. Yay! :)

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 6, 2020
CommentsContent: The monitor is great for the price. I can use this monitor in either landscape or portrait mode. I have bought another HDMI switch and connected two inputs to this monitor. The monitor is set to 60 Hz by default so you will have to change it t 75 Hz. The speaker is not that great because it doesn't sound loud enough but I guess it's a nice feature to have anyway. The bezels are almost non-existent. I kind of wish that the bezel on the bottom was black because it would blend so well. Also, the monitor is easy to setup as it doesn't require you to have any special tools. One problem that I am facing is that the power cable is very loose on the back where it connects to the monitor and the monitor turns off if I move the power cable around. I am not sure if it's the male adapter on the end of the power cable or the female adapter of the monitor itself but I plan to contact the seller regarding this issue and return it if the cable issue isn't resolved. Other than that, the monitor is good for the price.

CommentsTitle: Fantastic monitor for a fantastic price!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 7, 2020
CommentsContent: I got this monitor for working from home. It's been great for work! Since this monitor has built-in speakers, on some weeknights and most weekends I use it as a nice small secondary TV by connecting my Roku to it. So during weekdays it serves me very well for work purposes, and some weeknights and most weekends it also serves me very well as a secondary TV.Regardless of whether I use it for work or as a TV, the picture quality and sound from the speakers are great! The menu system is well done and gives you enough control to alter the picture settings or adjust the volume of the speakers.All in all this is one of the best electronic devices I've purchased in recent memory! To echo the title of my review, this is a fantastic monitor for a fantastic price!

CommentsTitle: Doesn't turn back on once gone to sleep by itself.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2021
CommentsContent: Major pain in the b****.  I use this as an extended monitor for my son's school Chromebook.  Once the Chromebook has gone to 'sleep', to get the monitor back on each time I've to unplug and plug back the HDMI cable.  I've used LG and Samsung monitors of the same category on the same Chromebook, never had this issue.  Decided to get this model because of the built-in speakers.  Then the speakers sound worse than the Chromebook's built-in speaker. Also, it takes longer than the three other monitors (LG, Samsung, Dell) of the same category I use.  Being a long-time user of HP computers, I'm very disappointed in HP.  I've already given up on their printers.  That's another story.

CommentsTitle: Happy with my purchase, previous reviewers are confused.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2021
CommentsContent: I expected this to be 60hz and without built-in speakers due to some of the reviewers alleging false advertising. Now that I have my hands on it I can confidently say that they do not know what they are talking about. The display runs at 60hz by default, but can be set at 75hz in the display adapter settings (not Windows settings, the actual adapter settings). The speaker works fine, and sounds decent if you keep your expectations reasonable. To clarify I have it connected with DisplayPort, so I cannot vouch for HDMI but would expect the experience to be the same. I got this to use as a second screen in portrait orientation, and you can't beat it for the price. I needed something that was cheap to use for displaying digital textbooks, and for that purpose I really don't have any complaints.Pros: 75hz, bright, colors look good, included stand swivels (clockwise only), DisplayPort and HDMI inputs, built in speaker is a nice touch and doesn't sound too bad, arrived within three days w/o prime.Cons: The silver bezel looks a bit odd when in portrait (who cares), 5ms response time acceptable but not ideal for gaming.You could game on this, but might want to spend a little more on something with a lower response time. For day-to-day browsing, watching videos, a second monitor, and light gaming you can't go wrong with it.TL;DR: yes it's 75hz, yes it has a speaker, worth my $110, would buy again.

CommentsTitle: Great for gamer on a budget, or as a backup.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 21, 2021
CommentsContent:
You can read a far better review than what I'll provide on displayninja.com, if you want a more technical write-up. I am reviewing this from a budget gaming / everyday use standpoint.

I've been impressed with this monitor for what I paid for it, so far. I use this as my main monitor right now due to budget concerns. I bought two, so I can use dual monitors in the future, or as a backup. I'm reviewing this product as a budget gamer, not as someone who needs perfect color or accuracy.

The monitor has very low input lag (this has nothing to do with advertised response time; read up on input lag if you don't know) which is great! I previously used the ASUS vh236h, which was a monitor that was used for years in professional fighting game events. This feels the same or better to me, though I do not have professional testing tools available. It rated ~10ms on displayninja's review.

The monitor runs at 60hz or 75hz. You can set it up in your graphics card control panel. I experience one bug where when I set the scaling on my nVidia card and each time I choose 60hz, it defaults back to 75. This is only for the scaling options - the native resolution of 1920x1080 runs at either. Also, the game Spelunky locks at 50 frames per second, regardless of the setting in my graphics control panel. This IS a known issue with Spelunky that I hadn't experienced on my old monitor. I can fix it by keeping VLC open in the background while the game is on. I wanted to mention this just to provide as much detail as possible about my experience.

I use the monitor in portrait mode for pinball, and it's nice having the IPS screen so it is viewable from either angle, if I am slightly to the left or right (playing with two people for example). There are no issues tracking the ball, or any extreme ghosting using the default settings. It's even easier tracking the ball at 75hz, but this can screw up some physics in certain pinball games.

I also play a lot of oldschool Doom - online and off. It's a very fast paced game, and monitor performs well for what it is.

As far as inputs, I use the Display Port input, and had to purchase a cable. Be aware that if you have an older computer / graphics card, and choose to use the VGA input, that can add some slight input lag converting the analog signal to digital. I also have my Nintendo Switch hooked up to the HDMI port. I like how the monitor switches inputs automatically depending on signal, so I can hit Windows Key + L (locking computer, which causes monitor to go to sleep after a minute), then turn on the switch and it will change inputs for me after a couple minutes.

Some reviews have mentioned that the cables come loose. So far, mine are tight, but I can see the power cable loosening after many rotations into portrait mode. Will update review if I experience this.

The speakers are actually not terrible. They aren't too tinny or grating on my ears like my past monitor. I use dedicated speakers for PC, but at the moment am happy with the onboard speakers for the Switch. There doesn't seem to be a quick shortcut button for volume, however. So I have to go into the menu to adjust. I just keep it at 10, and disable sound on my PC's Display Port connection so I don't have to worry about it.

Speaking of menus, I find this one easy to use and functional. When you hit a button under the monitor, a shortcut menu will appear onscreen right above the buttons, so you know which one to hit without memorizing them. The menu is speedy and responsive. Keep in mind I've been using the ASUS vh236 for the past many years, so compared to that, this is amazing. I do not have much else to compare it too, however.

A final note - one of my monitors had a small bit of plastic that wasn't molded correctly, and protrudes upwards from the bottom bezel. It does not reach the viewable area of the screen though, and is unnoticeable unless I'm looking for it.

TLDR:
-great for the budget gamer who doesn't mind 60/75 hz vs 120+
-low input lag
-rotates into portrait mode
-lightweight, easy to rotate and tilt (tilts backward, and very slightly forward)
-speakers are passable
-thin upper and side bezels (good for multi-monitor setup)
-easy to use menu
-no volume shortcut, have to navigate menu

If you are on a budget, or just need another monitor, and can get this <=$120, it's an excellent deal.
